title: Firstfruits and Declaration of Loyalty
summary: Deuteronomy 26 instructs Israel to bring the firstfruits of the land and declare their history and gratitude to God. It concludes with a covenant affirmation—Israel commits to obey God, and God declares them His treasured possession.

faq.question: What is the purpose of the firstfruits offering?
faq.answer: To honor God as provider and remember Israel’s deliverance from Egypt.

faq.question: What covenant commitment is affirmed?
faq.answer: Israel promises to obey God, and God promises to bless and exalt them as His people.
